sen.j: 厚化粧（あつげしょう）とは、化粧品を多めに使った、素顔とは明らかに違う感じの化粧の事。
sen.e: Atsugesho means heavy makeup in Japanese, which is to use more cosmetics than usual and make one's face look obviously different from the face without makeup.
Atsugesho is a word in Japanese referring the use of heavy makeup and cosmetics in order to make one's face look obviously different from a face without makeup.
sen.cmt: fixed gramma to read more naturally
sen.e: Atsugesho is a word in Japanese referring the use of heavy makeup and cosmetics in order to make one's face look obviously different from a face without makeup.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 概ね、自然の肌色より大幅に明るい色のファンデーションを塗る、ベースリッチ型と、濃い色のアイシャドーを広い範囲に塗ったり濃い色のほほ紅、口紅を塗ったりするポイントリッチ型、及び、その両方に分類される。
sen.e: On the whole, atsugesho can be classified into three types: the based-rich type in which the much lighter colored foundation than the natural flesh color is put on; the pointed-rich type in which the thick colored eye shadow is put on widely, or the thick colored blusher or lipstick is put on; and the combination of the both types.

As a whole, atsugesho can be classified into three types: the first is a rich-based type in which a color foundation is used that is much lighter than a natural skin color; another is a rich-pointed type in which thickly colored eye shadow is used widely around the eyes, thickly colored blush on the cheeks and lipstick; or a combination of both types.
sen.cmt: On the whole >As a whole; based-rich > rich-based; pointed-rich > rich-pointed; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: As a whole, atsugesho can be classified into three types: the first is a rich-based type in which a color foundation is used that is much lighter than a natural skin color; another is a rich-pointed type in which thickly colored eye shadow is used widely around the eyes, thickly colored blush on the cheeks and lipstick; or a combination of both types.

sen.j: 加齢による厚化粧
sen.e: Atsugesho Involved in Aging
Atsugesho Involved in Aging
Atsugesho Involved in Aging

sen.j: 年齢を重ねてくると皺が増えたり肌が荒れやすくなってきたりするので、それをカバーするため、若い時と比べて厚化粧になる場合が多い。
sen.e: As one grows older, the wrinkles in the face increase and the skin becomes liable to get rough, so that the makeup often gets heavier than in youth in order to cover them.
Wrinkles in the face increase and skin is liable to become rough with aging, so makeup often gets heavier the older one gets in order to cover up these imperfections.
sen.cmt: changed "to cover them" to "to cover up these imperfections";
sen.e: Wrinkles in the face increase and skin is liable to become rough with aging, so makeup often gets heavier the older one gets in order to cover up these imperfections.

sen.j: 只、年増の厚化粧という言葉に象徴されるように、好感を持たれない場合が多い。
sen.e: However, as the phrase "toshima no atsugesho" (heavy makeup by a youngish woman) symbolizes, it often makes unfavorable impression.
However, symbolized by the phrase "toshima no atsugesho" (heavy makeup by a middle-aged woman), using such heavy makeup often gives an unfavorable impression.
sen.cmt: changed "youngish woman" to "middle-aged woman" for "年増"; fixed grammar
sen.e: However, symbolized by the phrase "toshima no atsugesho" (heavy makeup by a middle-aged woman), using such heavy makeup often gives an unfavorable impression.

sen.j: 療養上の厚化粧
sen.e: Atsugesho Involved in Medical Treatment
Atsugesho Related to Medical Treatment
Atsugesho Related to Medical Treatment

sen.j: しみ、あざ、傷あと、等を目立たなくするためにファンデーションでカバーするカモフラージュメイクがあるが、そのために厚化粧の印象になる場合が多い。
sen.e: In order to conceal stains, bruises, scars, and the like, the camouflaged makeup is used as a means of covering them with the foundation, but it often leads to the impression of atsugesho.
In order to conceal things like stains, bruises and scars, camouflage makeup is used to cover them with foundation, but this often leads to the impression of atsugesho.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In order to conceal things like stains, bruises and scars, camouflage makeup is used to cover them with foundation, but this often leads to the impression of atsugesho.

sen.j: この点については、各化粧品メーカーも承知してるようで、自然の肌色、肌の質感に極力近づけるように研究中らしい。
sen.e: Every cosmetics manufacturer seems to know this issue, and is said to be making research on how to get as close as possible to the natural color and feel of skin.
Every cosmetics manufacturer understands this issue, and are continually researching how to get as close as possible to the natural color and feel of skin.
Every cosmetics manufacturer understands this issue, and are continually researching how to get as close as possible to the natural color and feel of skin.

sen.j: 職業上の厚化粧
sen.e: Atsugesho Involved in Occupations
Atsugesho Related to Occupations
Atsugesho Related to Occupations

sen.j: 職業によっては若い内から(時には少年少女の頃から)厚化粧する場合がある。
sen.e: Some occupations require atsugesho from the youth (sometimes from the boyhood or the girlhood).
A number of occupations require the use of atsugesho from a young age (sometimes from boyhood or girlhood).
sen.cmt: Some > A number of; added "the use of"; from the youth > from a young age
sen.e: A number of occupations require the use of atsugesho from a young age (sometimes from boyhood or girlhood).

sen.j: 若い女性の場合、その職業の影響で普段の化粧も同年代の他の職業の女性より厚化粧になる傾向がある。
sen.e: Particularly, when the young women of those occupations make themselves up for usual life, they tend to wear heavier makeup than the women of the same age of the other occupations.
In particular, when young women with these types of occupations use makeup for everyday life, they tend to wear heavier makeup than women of the same age who work in other occupations.
In particular, when young women with these types of occupations use makeup for everyday life, they tend to wear heavier makeup than women of the same age who work in other occupations.

sen.j: 舞台化粧
sen.e: Stage Makeup
Stage Makeup
Stage Makeup

sen.j: 素顔のままや薄化粧では観客に対する印象が薄いため、思い切った厚化粧をする場合が多い。
sen.e: Because it makes little impression to the theater audience to appear on the stage with the face wearing no makeup or light makeup, the makeup often gets heavy daringly.
Makeup often gets daringly heavy on the stage since it makes very little impression to the audience to appear with only light or no makeup.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Makeup often gets daringly heavy on the stage since it makes very little impression to the audience to appear with only light or no makeup.

sen.j: バレエ
sen.e: Ballet
Ballet
Ballet

sen.j: 彫りの深さ、立体感を強調するのが特徴。
sen.e: It is characterized by emphasizing the clear-cut features and stereoscopic effects of the face.
Makeup in ballet is characterized by emphasizing the clear-cut features and stereoscopic effects of the face.
Makeup in ballet is characterized by emphasizing the clear-cut features and stereoscopic effects of the face.

sen.j: 役柄による多少の違いはあるが、おおむね、自然の肌色より若干明るめ(ロシア系は、かなり白目)のファンデーションを顔全体に塗る、茶色がかったほほ紅、ノーズシャドーを入れる、青いアイシャドーを、まぶた一杯に差す、茶色のダブルラインを入れる、上下のまぶたにアイライナーを、思いっきり太く入れる、付けまつげを付ける、鮮やかな口紅を、輪郭をはっきり描く、という場合が多い。
sen.e: There are some differences depending on the roles, but generally speaking, ballet dancers frequently put on the foundation which is somewhat lighter than the natural flesh color (considerably whitish in Russian dancers' case) on the whole face, put on the brownish blusher and nose shadow, put on the blue eye shadow on the whole eyelids, put on the brown double line, put on the boldly thick eyeliner on the upper and lower eyelids, wear tipped eyelashes, and paint the shape of the lips clearly with the brilliant-colored lipsticks.

There are some differences depending on the role, but in general, ballet dancers frequently put on foundation somewhat lighter than natural flesh color (considerably whitish in the case of Russian dancers) on their entire face, brownish blush and nose shadow, blue eye shadow covering the whole eyelid as well as a brown double line, boldly thick eyeliner on the upper and lower eyelids, they wear tipped eyelashes, and clearly paint the shape of the lips with brilliant-colored lipstick.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: There are some differences depending on the role, but in general, ballet dancers frequently put on foundation somewhat lighter than natural flesh color (considerably whitish in the case of Russian dancers) on their entire face, brownish blush and nose shadow, blue eye shadow covering the whole eyelid as well as a brown double line, boldly thick eyeliner on the upper and lower eyelids, they wear tipped eyelashes, and clearly paint the shape of the lips with brilliant-colored lipstick.

sen.j: 但し、子供の場合は若干略式になる場合が多い。
sen.e: However, it is usual for the children to wear somewhat simplified makeup.
Children, however, usually wear more simplified makeup.
Children, however, usually wear more simplified makeup.

sen.j: フラメンコ、サンバ、フラダンス、社交ダンス等もバレエと似通った傾向がある。
sen.e: In the cases of the flamenco, the samba, the hula, the ballroom dancing, and so on, the tendency which resembles the ballet is seen in makeup.
In cases such as the flamenco, the samba, hula dancing, and ballroom dancing, there is a tendency to use makeup that resembles what is used in ballet.
sen.cmt: changed "and so on" to "such as" and used earlier in the sentence; the hula > hula dancing; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In cases such as the flamenco, the samba, hula dancing, and ballroom dancing, there is a tendency to use makeup that resembles what is used in ballet.

sen.j: 現代舞踊
sen.e: Contemporary dance
Contemporary Dance
Contemporary Dance

sen.j: モダンダンス、ジャズダンス、コンテンポラリー・ダンス等の化粧もバレエに似てるが、バレエよりは写実的な感じになる。
sen.e: The makeup of the modern dance, the jazz dance, the contemporary dance, etc. resembles that of the ballet, but it looks more realistic than that of the ballet.
Makeup used in modern dance, jazz dance, contemporary dance, etc. resembles that of the ballet but looks more realistic.
sen.cmt: eliminated "the" before "modern" "jazz" and "contemporary"; eliminated "than that of the ballet"
sen.e: Makeup used in modern dance, jazz dance, contemporary dance, etc. resembles that of the ballet but looks more realistic.

sen.j: 歌舞伎
sen.e: Kabuki
Kabuki
Kabuki

sen.j: おおむね平面的で様式美を強調する。
sen.e: In the case of Kabuki (Japanese traditional drama performed by male actors), the makeup basically looks flat and emphasizes the beauty of style.
In Kabuki (Japanese traditional drama performed by male actors), makeup basically looks flat and emphasizes the beauty of style.
In Kabuki (Japanese traditional drama performed by male actors), makeup basically looks flat and emphasizes the beauty of style.

sen.j: 娘役や、同年代の恋する男性の役の場合は、洗顔の後、鬢付け油を顔全体にすり込む、眉を硬い鬢付け油で塗りつぶす、胸、首、襟足に練りおしろいを塗り、スポンジで伸ばす、顔に練りおしろいを塗り、スポンジで伸ばす、赤でノーズシャドー、アイシャドー、ほほ紅を差す、目じりに紅を差す、眉を、先ず赤で、続けて黒で描く、真っ赤な口紅を、輪郭をはっきり描く、という具合。
sen.e: For example, a Kabuki actor who plays the role of a young girl or the role of a man of the same age that is in love, after facial cleansing, rubs bintsukeabura (hair oil) into the whole face, covers the eyebrows with hard bintsukeabura, rubs face powder paste on the chest, the neck, and the nape and then spreads it with a sponge, rubs face powder paste on the face and then spreads it with a sponge, puts on red nose shadow, eye shadow, and blusher, applies crimson to the ends of the eyes, paints the eyebrows firstly with red and then with black, paints the shape of the lips clearly with a bright red lipstick, and the like.

For example, a Kabuki actor who plays the role of a young girl or young man in love will wash their face, rub bintsukeabura (hair oil) onto their whole face, cover their eyebrows with hard bintsukeabura, rub face powder paste on their chest, their neck and nape and then spread it with a sponge; then they rub face powder paste on their face and spread it with a sponge, put on red nose shadow, eye shadow, and blusher, apply crimson to the ends of their eyes, paint their eyebrows first with red and then with black, and paint the shape of their lips clearly with a bright red lipstick.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: For example, a Kabuki actor who plays the role of a young girl or young man in love will wash their face, rub bintsukeabura (hair oil) onto their whole face, cover their eyebrows with hard bintsukeabura, rub face powder paste on their chest, their neck and nape and then spread it with a sponge; then they rub face powder paste on their face and spread it with a sponge, put on red nose shadow, eye shadow, and blusher, apply crimson to the ends of their eyes, paint their eyebrows first with red and then with black, and paint the shape of their lips clearly with a bright red lipstick.

sen.j: 黒のアイライナーは通常は使わない(但し、中村雀右衛門は使う)。
sen.e: Usually, most actors don't use black eyeliner (except for Jakuemon NAKAMURA).
Most actors usually do not use black eyeliner (except for Jakuemon NAKAMURA).
Most actors usually do not use black eyeliner (except for Jakuemon NAKAMURA).

sen.j: 荒事(あらごと)と呼ばれる勇猛な男性の役は隈取り(くまどり)と呼ばれる赤や黒の線を入れて勇猛な感じを強調する。
sen.e: An actor who plays the role of a brave man called aragoto (Kabuki play featuring exaggerated posture, makeup, and costume) draws the red or black lines called kumadori on the face to emphasize the impression that he is brave.

An actor who plays the role of a brave man called an aragoto (a Kabuki play featuring exaggerated postures, makeup, and costumes) draws red or black lines called kumadori on their face to give the impression that he is brave.
sen.cmt: changed "emphasize the impression" to "give the impression; fixed grammar
sen.e: An actor who plays the role of a brave man called an aragoto (a Kabuki play featuring exaggerated postures, makeup, and costumes) draws red or black lines called kumadori on their face to give the impression that he is brave.

sen.j: 他の役柄も、基本は同じ。
sen.e: Fundamentally, actors who play the other roles also wear similar makeup.
Actors who play the other roles wear basically the same makeup.
sen.cmt: fundamentally > basically; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Actors who play the other roles wear basically the same makeup.

sen.j: 歌舞伎舞踊
sen.e: Kabuki Buyo
Kabuki Buyo
Kabuki Buyo

sen.j: 上記の歌舞伎と、基本的に同じだが、舞踊の発表会では黒のアイライナーを太く入れる場合が多い、極稀に、付けまつげを付ける場合もある。
sen.e: The makeup of Kabuki Buyo (Kabuki dance) is basically similar to that of aforesaid Kabuki, but in the recital of dance, the dancers often put on thick black eyeliners, and sometimes wear tipped eyelashes excessively.

Although the makeup of Kabuki Buyo (Kabuki dance) is essentially the same as the aforementioned Kabuki, the dancers often put on thick black eyeliner and sometimes wear excessively tipped eyelashes during dance recitals.
sen.cmt: changed "but" to "Although"; aforesaid > aforementioned; rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Although the makeup of Kabuki Buyo (Kabuki dance) is essentially the same as the aforementioned Kabuki, the dancers often put on thick black eyeliner and sometimes wear excessively tipped eyelashes during dance recitals.

sen.j: 大衆演劇
sen.e: Taishu Engeki
Taishu Engeki
Taishu Engeki

sen.j: 上記の歌舞伎と、基本的に同じだが、アイメークに赤をあまり使わず、黒のアイライナーを思いっきり太く入れる、口紅は輪郭だけ赤く、内側はクリーム色に塗る場合が多い。
sen.e: The makeup of Taishu Engeki (popular drama) is basically similar to that of aforesaid Kabuki, but there are many cases where the actors don't use so much red for eye makeup, put on daringly thick black eyeliners, and paint only the outlines of the lips in red and the inside in cream color.

The makeup used in Taishu Engeki (popular drama) is also essentially the same as the aforementioned Kabuki, but there are many cases in which the actors do not use as much red for their eye makeup, putting on an uncommon amount of thick, black eyeliner, and paint only the outlines of their lips in red with the inside painted a cream color.
sen.cmt: basically > essentially; aforesaid > aforementioned; put on daringly thick > putting on an uncommon amount of thick; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The makeup used in Taishu Engeki (popular drama) is also essentially the same as the aforementioned Kabuki, but there are many cases in which the actors do not use as much red for their eye makeup, putting on an uncommon amount of thick, black eyeliner, and paint only the outlines of their lips in red with the inside painted a cream color.

sen.j: 民謡等の舞踊
sen.e: Buyo for Minyo, etc.
Buyo for Minyo, etc.
Buyo for Minyo, etc.

sen.j: 歌舞伎舞踊とバレエの中間的、折衷的な感じ。
sen.e: The makeup of Minyo Buyo (dances for local folk songs) makes the middle and compromised impression between those of Kabuki Buyo and the ballet.
The makeup used in Minyo Buyo (dances for local folk songs) takes the middle road compromising between the styles of Kabuki Buyo and ballet.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The makeup used in Minyo Buyo (dances for local folk songs) takes the middle road compromising between the styles of Kabuki Buyo and ballet.

sen.j: ベースの作り方はバレエに似ており、ポイントメークは歌舞伎舞踊に近い。
sen.e: The base makeup resembles that of the ballet, and the point makeup is close to that of Kabuki Buyo.
The base makeup resembles the ballet and the point makeup resembles what is used in Kabuki Buyo.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The base makeup resembles the ballet and the point makeup resembles what is used in Kabuki Buyo.

sen.j: 青いアイシャドーを使う場合もある。
sen.e: There are some cases in which the blue eye shadow is used.
There are some cases in which blue eye shadow is used as well.
There are some cases in which blue eye shadow is used as well.

sen.j: 歌舞伎舞踊を素踊り、又は半素で、鬘を被らず、地毛で結う場合も、このような化粧になる場合が多い。
sen.e: Also, when Kabuki Buyo is performed as suodori (dancing without costume and hairpiece) or as hansu (semi-suodori) for which the natural hair is arranged without a wig, this style of makeup is often applied.
sen.cmt: 「半素」の正式な読み方と英訳は不明。「半分」＋「素踊り」と解釈して「hansu (semi-suodori)」としてみた。
sen.e: Additionally, this style of makeup is often used when Kabuki Buyo is performed as a suodori (dancing without a costume or hairpiece) or as a hansu (semi-suodori) when natural hair is arranged without a wig.
sen.cmt: Also > Additionally; rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Additionally, this style of makeup is often used when Kabuki Buyo is performed as a suodori (dancing without a costume or hairpiece) or as a hansu (semi-suodori) when natural hair is arranged without a wig.

sen.j: 琉球舞踊も同様で、ポイントメークは歌舞伎舞踊と殆ど同じ。
sen.e: The makeup of Ryukyu Buyo (Ryukyu dance) is similar, and the point makeup is almost the same as that of Kabuki Buyo.
The makeup used in Ryukyu Buyo (Ryukyu dance) is similar as well, and the point makeup is nearly the same as that used in Kabuki Buyo.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The makeup used in Ryukyu Buyo (Ryukyu dance) is similar as well, and the point makeup is nearly the same as that used in Kabuki Buyo.

sen.j: 舞楽では童舞のみ厚化粧が原則だが化粧しない場合がある一方で、大人の舞楽も厚化粧する団体もある。
sen.e: As to Bugaku (traditional Japanese court music accompanied by dancing), while it is a rule to apply atsugesho only to Dobu (dance performed by children) and sometimes no makeup is worn, there are some groups which apply atsugesho to Bugaku performed by adults.

In Bugaku (traditional Japanese court music accompanied by dancing), while it is a rule to apply atsugesho only for Dobu (a dance performed by children) with sometimes no makeup at all, there are some groups which apply atsugesho on adults.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In Bugaku (traditional Japanese court music accompanied by dancing), while it is a rule to apply atsugesho only for Dobu (a dance performed by children) with sometimes no makeup at all, there are some groups which apply atsugesho on adults.

sen.j: 時代劇
sen.e: Jidaigeki
Jidaigeki
Jidaigeki

sen.j: 歌舞伎、歌舞伎舞踊に似てるが、やや写実的になり、ベースは肌色寄りになり、アイメークも若干控えめになる。
sen.e: The makeup of Jidaigeki (period drama) is similar to those of Kabuki and Kabuki Buyo, but it is a little more realistic with the base being closer to the flesh color and the eye makeup also being somewhat more modest.

The makeup of Jidaigeki (period drama) is similar to Kabuki and Kabuki Buyo, but it is a little more realistic with the base being closer to natural skin color as well as eye makeup that is more modest.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The makeup of Jidaigeki (period drama) is similar to Kabuki and Kabuki Buyo, but it is a little more realistic with the base being closer to natural skin color as well as eye makeup that is more modest.

sen.j: 映画、テレビドラマの場合はフイルム、ビデオに写る事から、更に写実的になるが、それでも、アイライナーが太くなる等、現代劇よりは厚化粧の傾向はある。
sen.e: Even though makeup is even more realistic in movies and television dramas, there is a tendency to use thicker eyeliner and other makeup than what is used in Jidaigeki since it comes out on film and video.
sen.cmt: untranslated; Made my own translation. It looks as though 現代劇 is supposed to be 時代劇 here, so I translated it as "Jidaigeki" instead of "contemporary drama"
sen.e: Even though makeup is even more realistic in movies and television dramas, there is a tendency to use thicker eyeliner and other makeup than what is used in Jidaigeki since it comes out on film and video.

sen.j: 現代劇
sen.e: Contemporary Drama
Contemporary Drama
Contemporary Drama

sen.j: 役柄にもよるが、時代劇より、更に写実的な感じ、しかし、舞台の場合は全般的にやはりかなり厚化粧の感じになる。
sen.e: The makeup of a contemporary drama, although there are differences according to the roles, looks much more realistic than that of Jidaigeki, but especially on the stage, considerable atsugesho is generally applied after all.

The makeup used in contemporary dramas varies depending on the role, and although it looks far more realistic than what is used in Jidaigeki, a consirable amount of atsugesho is generally applied when performances are on a stage.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The makeup used in contemporary dramas varies depending on the role, and although it looks far more realistic than what is used in Jidaigeki, a consirable amount of atsugesho is generally applied when performances are on a stage.

sen.j: ミュージカル等
sen.e: Musical and the like
Musicals etc.
Musicals etc.

sen.j: ミュージカル、宝塚歌劇、等は演出等にもよるが、演出を重視する場合ほど、厚化粧になる。
sen.e: The makeup of musical, Takarazuka Revue and the like varies depending on the stage effects, but the greater emphasis is placed on the stage effects, the heavier atsugesho is applied.
Although makeup used in musicals, Takarazuka Revue, etc. varies depending on the stage effects, atsugesho becomes more heavily applied as greater emphasis is placed on the stage effects.
Although makeup used in musicals, Takarazuka Revue, etc. varies depending on the stage effects, atsugesho becomes more heavily applied as greater emphasis is placed on the stage effects.

sen.j: 西洋や現代が題材の場合は概ねバレエと同様、時代劇、等、和風の場合は歌舞伎舞踊や大衆演劇に近い感じになる。
sen.e: When the subject matter of the program fare is related to the West or the present age, the makeup is similar to that of the ballet on the whole, but when it is proper to Japan such as Jidaigeki, the makeup seems to be close to those of Kabuki Buyo or Taishu Engeki.

When the subject matter of a program is related to the West or modern times, makeup is generally similar to that of ballet, but when they are in Japanese style such as Jidaigeki, makeup seems to be closer to that of Kabuki Buyo or Taishu Engeki.
sen.cmt: the program > a program; eliminated "fare"; present age > modern times; on the whole > generally; proper to Japan > Japanese style; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: When the subject matter of a program is related to the West or modern times, makeup is generally similar to that of ballet, but when they are in Japanese style such as Jidaigeki, makeup seems to be closer to that of Kabuki Buyo or Taishu Engeki.

sen.j: 花柳界
sen.e: Karyukai
Karyukai
Karyukai

sen.j: 芸者、遊女、等は伝統的に厚化粧になる。
sen.e: In Karyukai (the world of geisha), geisha (Japanese professional female entertainer at drinking parties), yujo (a prostitute), etc. put on atsugesho traditionally.
In Karyukai (the world of the geisha), geisha (Japanese professional female entertainers at drinking parties), yujo (a prostitute), etc. tradtionally put on atsugesho.
In Karyukai (the world of the geisha), geisha (Japanese professional female entertainers at drinking parties), yujo (a prostitute), etc. tradtionally put on atsugesho.

sen.j: 屋外では浮いた感じになる厚化粧も、屋内の、蝋燭の明かり程度の明るさでは調和する場合が多い。
sen.e: While atsugesho makes an unsuitable impression outdoors, it often harmonizes with the level of the light of burning candles indoors.
While this kind of atsugesho does not look very good outdoors, it often harmonizes with the level of light created by candles indoors.
sen.cmt: added "this kind of"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: While this kind of atsugesho does not look very good outdoors, it often harmonizes with the level of light created by candles indoors.

sen.j: 歌舞伎の娘役と、基本は同じであるが、眉を塗りつぶさず、自然な感じで描く、アイメークも控えめになる、等の違いはある。
sen.e: The makeup is basically the same as that of the role of a girl in Kabuki, but there are some differences such as not covering the eyebrows, drawing the eyebrows naturally, putting on the modest eye makeup, and so on.
Their makeup is basically the same as that of a girl acting in Kabuki, but differences include not covering the eyebrows, drawing them naturally, and putting on modest eye makeup.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Their makeup is basically the same as that of a girl acting in Kabuki, but differences include not covering the eyebrows, drawing them naturally, and putting on modest eye makeup.

sen.j: 日本髪でない場合は白塗りにならないが、同年代の他の職業の女性より、かなり厚化粧になる。
sen.e: Unless they wear Japanese coiffure, they don't paint shironuri (white makeup), but apply more considerable atsugesho than the women of the same age of the other occupations.
Unless they wear a Japanese coiffure, they do not use shironuri (white makeup), but they do apply a more considerable amount of atsugesho than women of the same age in other occupations.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Unless they wear a Japanese coiffure, they do not use shironuri (white makeup), but they do apply a more considerable amount of atsugesho than women of the same age in other occupations.

sen.j: 京都の舞妓、芸妓
sen.e: Maiko and Geigi in Kyoto
Maiko and Geigi in Kyoto
Maiko and Geigi in Kyoto

sen.j: 舞妓になりたての時は黒のアイライナーを使わず、口紅は下唇のみに差す。
sen.e: A novice of maiko (apprentice geisha) does not use the black eyeliner, and put on lipstick only on the lower lip.
A novice of maiko (apprentice geisha) does not use black eyeliner and they only put lipstick on their lower lip.
A novice of maiko (apprentice geisha) does not use black eyeliner and they only put lipstick on their lower lip.

sen.j: その後、上唇にも差すようになり、黒のアイライナーを使うようになる。
sen.e: Afterward, a maiko begins to put on lipstick on the upper lip, too, and to use the black eyeliner.
Later on, maiko begin putting lipstick on the upper lip and use black eyeliner as well.
Later on, maiko begin putting lipstick on the upper lip and use black eyeliner as well.

sen.j: 襟替えの直前には先笄という髪型になり、その期間中お歯黒を塗る。
sen.e: Immediately before erigae (promotion to a full-fledged geisha), a maiko changes her hairstyle into a sakko fashion (one of maiko's hairstyles), and apply ohaguro (black painted teeth) during that period of time.
Immediately before their erigae (promotion to a full-fledged geisha), maiko change their hairstyle into a sakko fashion (one of maiko's hairstyles) and apply ohaguro (black painted teeth).
sen.cmt: added "their" before "erigae"; eliminated "during that period of time"; fixed grammar
sen.e: Immediately before their erigae (promotion to a full-fledged geisha), maiko change their hairstyle into a sakko fashion (one of maiko's hairstyles) and apply ohaguro (black painted teeth).

sen.j: 芸妓になると、眉をはっきり描くようになり、アイライナーも舞妓時代より太くなるため、舞妓時代より、大人っぽい感じになる。
sen.e: After being promoted to a geigi, she starts drawing the eyebrows clearly and putting on the thicker eyeliners than in the maiko days, so that she begins to look more matured than in the maiko days.
After being promoted to a geigi, they begin to draw distinct eyebrows and put on thicker eyeliners than when they were a maiko in order to look more mature.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: After being promoted to a geigi, they begin to draw distinct eyebrows and put on thicker eyeliners than when they were a maiko in order to look more mature.

sen.j: 嶋原の太夫
sen.e: Tayu in Shimabara
Tayu in Shimabara
Tayu in Shimabara

sen.j: 上記の芸妓と、ほぼ同じ化粧で、必ずお歯黒を塗る。
sen.e: Tayu (geisha of the highest rank) wears almost the same makeup as the aforesaid geigi, and paint ohaguro without fail..
Tayu (geisha of the highest rank) wear almost the same makeup as a geigi and always apply ohaguro.
Tayu (geisha of the highest rank) wear almost the same makeup as a geigi and always apply ohaguro.

sen.j: 接客職業
sen.e: Hospitality Business
The Service Industry
The Service Industry

sen.j: 飲食店、デパート、ホテル、旅館の従業員、客室乗務員、レースクイーン、キャンペーンガール、等の職業も格式や雰囲気等に合わせた厚化粧になる場合が多い。
sen.e: The occupations such as the employees of restaurants, department stores, hotels and Japanese-style hotels, cabin attendants, race queens, campaign girls, are often required to put on atsugesho appropriate for their formality or atmosphere.

In occupations such as employees in restaurants, department stores, hotels, Japanese-style inns, cabin attendants, race queens, and campaign girls, women are often required to wear atsugesho appropriate to the formality and atmosphere of their job.
sen.cmt: Japanese-style hotels > Japanese-style inns; fixed grammar
sen.e: In occupations such as employees in restaurants, department stores, hotels, Japanese-style inns, cabin attendants, race queens, and campaign girls, women are often required to wear atsugesho appropriate to the formality and atmosphere of their job.

sen.j: ファッションモデル
sen.e: Fashion Model
Fashion Models
Fashion Models

sen.j: デザイナーによる最先端の服飾に合う様に化粧する場合が多く、勢い厚化粧になることがしばしばある。
sen.e: Fashion models always wear the makeup so as to go well with the latest clothes and accessories by a designer, and often put on atsugesho as a natural result.
Fashion models always wear makeup that goes well with the latest clothes and accessories made by a designer and often end up putting on atsugesho as a natural result.
Fashion models always wear makeup that goes well with the latest clothes and accessories made by a designer and often end up putting on atsugesho as a natural result.

sen.j: 子ども向けファッション雑誌や美容関係の図書ではモデルの3～13歳の少女も化粧する場合が割合多く、特に和服の場合は厚化粧になる傾向がある。
sen.e: In the fashion magazines or the books related to beauty treatment for children, the cases in which the three to thirteen years old girl models put on makeup are comparatively numerous, and the models tend to wear atsugeshou especially in wafuku (Japanese traditional clothes).

In fashion magazines or books related to beauty treatment for children, a large proportion of girl models aged three to thirteen wear makeup, especially when they are modelling for wafuku (Japanese traditional clothes).
sen.cmt: atsugeshou > atsugesho; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In fashion magazines or books related to beauty treatment for children, a large proportion of girl models aged three to thirteen wear makeup, especially when they are modelling for wafuku (Japanese traditional clothes).

sen.j: 演歌歌手
sen.e: Enka Singers
Enka Singers
Enka Singers

sen.j: 女性演歌歌手は全般的に厚化粧の場合が多い。
sen.e: The female enka (Japanese ballad) singers often wear atsugesho as a whole.
Female enka (Japanese ballad) singers almost always wear atsugesho.
Female enka (Japanese ballad) singers almost always wear atsugesho.

sen.j: 30歳以下でも同年代の他のジャンルの歌手より厚化粧になる場合が多い。
sen.e: Even those who are under 30 years old tend to wear heavier atsugesho than the singers of the same age in the other genres.
Even those who are under thirty years old tend to wear heavier atsugesho than singers of the same age in other genres.
Even those who are under thirty years old tend to wear heavier atsugesho than singers of the same age in other genres.

sen.j: 男性演歌歌手も、和服の場合は太いアイライナーを入れる、等、厚化粧の傾向はある。
sen.e: And the male enka singers too, when they are dressed in wafuku, tend to wear atsugesho, for example to draw the thick eyeliner.
Male enka singers tend to wear atsugesho as well when they dress in wafuku, such as thick eyeliner.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Male enka singers tend to wear atsugesho as well when they dress in wafuku, such as thick eyeliner.

sen.j: ムード歌謡等
sen.e: Mood Music, etc.
sen.cmt: 用語集に「ムード歌謡」＝「popular song」と登録されているが、これでは範囲が広すぎると思われるので左記のように言い換えた。
sen.e: Mood Music, etc.
Mood Music, etc.

sen.j: ムード歌謡、シャンソン、ラテン音楽、等の歌手にも演歌歌手と同様の傾向がある。
sen.e: The singers of the mood music, the shanson, the Latin music, etc. show the tendency similar to the enka singers as well.
Singers of mood music, shanson, Latin music, etc. show a tendency to wear makeup similar to enka singers as well.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Singers of mood music, shanson, Latin music, etc. show a tendency to wear makeup similar to enka singers as well.

sen.j: 男性歌手にも美輪明宏、美川憲一の様に女性と同様の化粧をするケースがある。
sen.e: There are some cases in which even the male singers wear the makeup similar to that of the female, such as Akihiro MIWA and Kenichi MIKAWA.
There are even some cases of male singers wearing makeup similar to that used by the women, such as Akihiro MIWA and Kenichi MIKAWA.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: There are even some cases of male singers wearing makeup similar to that used by the women, such as Akihiro MIWA and Kenichi MIKAWA.

sen.j: ロックバンド
sen.e: Rock Band
Rock Bands
Rock Bands

sen.j: ヘヴィメタルやヴィジュアル系のアーティストは観客にインパクトを与えるために厚化粧する場合が多い。
sen.e: The Heavy Metal or Visual artists often wear atsugesho in order to make an impact on the audience.
Heavy Metal or visual artists often wear atsugesho in order to make an impact on their audiences.
Heavy Metal or visual artists often wear atsugesho in order to make an impact on their audiences.

sen.j: アメリカ合衆国のキッスが有名。
sen.e: The Kiss of the United States of America is well-known in this aspect.
The band called Kiss of the United States of America is famous for their use of makeup.
sen.cmt: well-known > famous; in this aspect > for their use of makeup
sen.e: The band called Kiss of the United States of America is famous for their use of makeup.

sen.j: 歌舞伎の隈取りに似た化粧をするバンドもある。
sen.e: There are some bands whose members wear the makeup which resembles kumadori of Kabuki.
There are some bands whose members wear makeup resembling kumadori of Kabuki.
There are some bands whose members wear makeup resembling kumadori of Kabuki.

sen.j: 観客も、観覧時に、それを真似る場合が多い。
sen.e: And some of the audience often imitate when they watch and listen to the performance of those bands.
People in the audience often imitate the bands when they go to performances as well.
People in the audience often imitate the bands when they go to performances as well.

sen.j: 一部のスポーツ競技
sen.e: Some of the Sports Games
Sports
sen.cmt: "Sports" by itself seems the most natural here
sen.e: Sports

sen.j: フィギュアスケート、新体操、シンクロナイズドスイミング、競技ダンス、等、芸術性を競う競技においても、厚化粧する場合が多い。
sen.e: In the sports games in which to compete for artistic quality such as figure skating, rhythmic sportive gymnastics, synchronized swimming, athletic dance, etc., atsugesho is often applied, too.
Atsugesho is often used in sports where there is competition for artistic quality such as figure skating, rhythmic gymnastics, synchronized swimming, athletic dance, etc..
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more naturally; rhythmic sportive gymnastics > rhythmic gymnastics
sen.e: Atsugesho is often used in sports where there is competition for artistic quality such as figure skating, rhythmic gymnastics, synchronized swimming, athletic dance, etc..

sen.j: 物真似、お笑い、等
sen.e: Impersonation, Comical Performances, etc.
Impersonation, Comical Performances, etc.
Impersonation, Comical Performances, etc.

sen.j: 物真似、お笑い、等では企画内容や出演者の意図によって厚化粧をする場合がある。
sen.e: In impersonation, comical performances, etc., atsugesho is sometimes applied according to the planned content or the performers' intention.
In impersonation and comical performances, atsugesho is sometimes used to go along with planned content or to achieve an effect by the performer.
sen.cmt: eliminated "etc"; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: In impersonation and comical performances, atsugesho is sometimes used to go along with planned content or to achieve an effect by the performer.

sen.j: コロッケ (タレント)が上記の美川憲一の真似で美川に似た化粧で出演して人気を博し、美川の人気も回復、小梅太夫も舞台経験を生かした妖艶な舞台化粧で出演する、ゴリ＠ガレッジセールが厚化粧女装して松浦ゴリエとして出演する、等のケースがある。
sen.e: We can give some examples of this as follows: Korokke (an entertainer) has performed the impersonation of aforementioned Kenichi MIKAWA with the makeup resembling MIKAWA on to gain popularity, and MIKAWA also has regained popularity; Tayu KOUME has appeared with the bewitching makeup on by making use of the stage experience; Gori@Garage Sale has put on atsugesho and disguised himself as a woman to appear as Gorie MATSUURA, and so on.
sen.cmt: 「コロッケ」は食品を表わす「croquette」とすると発音がかけ離れてしまうので、「コロッケ」という固有名詞と考えてローマ字表記にした。「ガレッジセール」は発音が類似しているので、英語表記にした。
sen.e: A few examples of this are Korokke, (an entertainer) who gained popularity and increased the popularity of Kenichi MIKAWA by imitating MIKAWA and wearing similar makeup; Tayu KOUME has appeared with voluptuous makeup on, making use of her stage experience; Gori@Garage Sale has put on atsugesho and disguised himself as a woman to appear a Gorie MATSUURA, and so on.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: A few examples of this are Korokke, (an entertainer) who gained popularity and increased the popularity of Kenichi MIKAWA by imitating MIKAWA and wearing similar makeup; Tayu KOUME has appeared with voluptuous makeup on, making use of her stage experience; Gori@Garage Sale has put on atsugesho and disguised himself as a woman to appear a Gorie MATSUURA, and so on.

sen.j: その他
sen.e: The Others
Others
Others

sen.j: 普段は厚化粧しない俳優、歌手、等も、特別番組、化粧品等の広告や写真集、ビデオクリップ等を撮影する場合に、企画内容や、出演者や制作者の意図によって厚化粧をする場合がある。
sen.e: Even actors, singers, and the like who generally don't wear atsugesho may wear atsugesho in some cases following the planned content or the performers' or producers' intention, when they appear in the photographs or movies of the special program, the advertising for cosmetics and the others, the photo book or the video clips.

Actors, singers and so on who generally do not wear atsugesho may occassionally use it to follow planned content or to achieve an effect desired by the performers themselves or by a producer when they appear in photographs, movies, special programs, or advertisements for cosmetics.
sen.cmt: left out "the photo book or the video clips" as it was awkward and I could not find a way to make it fit in this sentence; fixed grammar
sen.e: Actors, singers and so on who generally do not wear atsugesho may occassionally use it to follow planned content or to achieve an effect desired by the performers themselves or by a producer when they appear in photographs, movies, special programs, or advertisements for cosmetics.

sen.j: 例えば、雅楽の演奏の時には殆ど化粧しない東儀秀樹が写真集の中で歌舞伎舞踊と同様の舞台化粧で登場する、元々厚化粧の印象が強い浜崎あゆみもデジタルカメラの広告で更に厚化粧になる、と言うようなケースは枚挙にいとまが無い。
sen.e: For example, Hideki TOGI who hardly ever puts on any makeup in the performance of gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) appears in the photo book with the stage makeup on which is similar to that of Kabuki Buyo, and Ayumi HAMASAKI who makes the strong impression that she wears atsugesho from the beginning put on the heavier atsugesho in the advertising of the digital camera, and the similar cases are too numerous to mention.

Hideki TOGI, for example, who hardly ever puts on any makeup during his performances in gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music), appeared in a photo book wearing stage makeup similar to what is used in Kabuki Buyo, and Ayumi HAMASAKI, who already gives a strong impression of wearing atsugesho, puts on even heavier atsugesho in advertisements for digital cameras and other similar cases too numerous to mention.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Hideki TOGI, for example, who hardly ever puts on any makeup during his performances in gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music), appeared in a photo book wearing stage makeup similar to what is used in Kabuki Buyo, and Ayumi HAMASAKI, who already gives a strong impression of wearing atsugesho, puts on even heavier atsugesho in advertisements for digital cameras and other similar cases too numerous to mention.

sen.j: 祭り等における厚化粧
sen.e: Atsugesho in Festivals, etc.
Atsugesho in Festivals, etc.
Atsugesho in Festivals, etc.

sen.j: 祭り、晴れ着、音楽や舞踊等の発表会においては、普段は化粧しない人でも厚化粧する場合が多い。
sen.e: When participating in festivals, being dressed in haregi (the best clothes), or performing in the recital of music or dance, even those who usually don't wear makeup may often put on atsugesho.
When participating in festivals, getting dressed up in haregi (the best clothes) or performing a recital of music or dance, even people who usually do not wear makeup often put on atsugesho.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: When participating in festivals, getting dressed up in haregi (the best clothes) or performing a recital of music or dance, even people who usually do not wear makeup often put on atsugesho.

sen.j: 特に、普段、化粧することが、先ずありえない、男性や少年少女が厚化粧する場合が多い。
sen.e: Particularly, the men and the boys and girls who have almost no probability of wearing makeup in their daily lives may often put on atsugesho.
In particular, men, boys and girls who are normally highly likely to never wear makeup during their daily lives may often put on atsugesho at festivals.
In particular, men, boys and girls who are normally highly likely to never wear makeup during their daily lives may often put on atsugesho at festivals.

sen.j: 稚児
sen.e: Chigo
Chigo
Chigo

sen.j: 神霊が降臨しやすいとされた少年少女に、神霊の理想的な姿に近づけるために厚化粧する場合が多い。
sen.e: Chigo (children of festivity) is the boys or girls onto whom the divine spirits is thought to be liable to descend, and in order to get closer to the images of the divine spirits they often tends to put on atsugesho.
Chigo (children of a festival) are the boys and girls onto whom divine spirits are believed to descend to, and in order to achieve images of the divine spirits they often put on atsugesho.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Chigo (children of a festival) are the boys and girls onto whom divine spirits are believed to descend to, and in order to achieve images of the divine spirits they often put on atsugesho.

sen.j: 特に妙厳寺(豊川市)は歌舞伎舞踊にきわめて近い。
sen.e: Especially, the makeup of the chigo of Myogon-ji Temple (Toyokawa City) resembles that of Kabuki Buyo very much.
The makeup of the chigo of Myogon-ji Temple (Toyokawa City) especially resemble what is seen in Kabuki Buyo.
sen.cmt: eliminated "very much"; changed locations of "especially"; fixed grammar
sen.e: The makeup of the chigo of Myogon-ji Temple (Toyokawa City) especially resemble what is seen in Kabuki Buyo.

sen.j: 元々少年少女は、肌がきれいなので、口紅を塗っただけで驚くほど美しく、華やかになるが、その一方で、年配女性と同様の厚化粧をしても年増の厚化粧という感じにならず、清楚で可憐で華やかな感じになる。
sen.e: Because the bare skins of the boys and girls are clear from the beginning, they become surprisingly beautiful and gorgeous only by putting on lipstick, but on the other hand, even if they wear as heavy atsugesho as the elderly ladies, they don't make an impression of toshima no atsugesho but become neat and dainty and gorgeous.

Since the bare skin of boys and girls is clean to begin with, they become surprisingly beautiful after only putting on lipstick, but even if they wear heavy atsugesho similar to elderly women, rather than giving the impression of toshima no atsugesho, they become even more beautiful.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Since the bare skin of boys and girls is clean to begin with, they become surprisingly beautiful after only putting on lipstick, but even if they wear heavy atsugesho similar to elderly women, rather than giving the impression of toshima no atsugesho, they become even more beautiful.

sen.j: 巫女
sen.e: Miko
Miko
Miko

sen.j: 普段は厚化粧しない場合が多いが、祭り等で巫女舞を奉納する場合は上記の稚児と同じ理由で厚化粧する場合がある。
sen.e: Miko (shrine maidens) usually don't wear atsugesho, but when they dedicate mikomai (female Shinto dance that the young girls each carry a small baton with belles) on the festivals, they sometimes wear atsugesho for the same reason as the aforesaid chigo.

Miko (shrine maidens) usually do not wear atsugesho, but when they dedicate mikomai (a female Shinto dance where young girls each carry a small baton with a bell) during festivals, they sometimes wear atsugesho for the same reason as chigo.
sen.cmt: don't > do not; belles > a bell; eliminated "the aforesaid"
sen.e: Miko (shrine maidens) usually do not wear atsugesho, but when they dedicate mikomai (a female Shinto dance where young girls each carry a small baton with a bell) during festivals, they sometimes wear atsugesho for the same reason as chigo.

sen.j: 春日大社(奈良市)に於いては、顔の輪郭をはっきり白で描くのが特徴。
sen.e: In Kasuga-taisha Shrine (Nara City), the makeup is characterized by painting the shape of faces white clearly.
In Kasuga-taisha Shrine (Nara City), makeup is characterized by clearly painting the shape of their faces white.
In Kasuga-taisha Shrine (Nara City), makeup is characterized by clearly painting the shape of their faces white.

sen.j: 踊り子
sen.e: Dancers
Dancers
Dancers

sen.j: 阿波踊りやよさこい祭りなどの踊り子も、華やかな衣装に合わせて、華やかな感じの厚化粧をする場合が多い。
sen.e: The dancers of Awa Odori (Awa Dancing Festival) and Yosakoi Matsuri (Yosakoi Festival) also generally wear atsugesho that look gorgeous in harmony with the gorgeous costumes.
The dancers of Awa Odori (Awa Dancing Festival) and Yosakoi Matsuri (Yosakoi Festival) also generally wear atsugesho to harmonize with the beauty of their costumes.
The dancers of Awa Odori (Awa Dancing Festival) and Yosakoi Matsuri (Yosakoi Festival) also generally wear atsugesho to harmonize with the beauty of their costumes.

sen.j: なかでも、よさこいの場合は歌舞伎の隈取りを思わせる派手な化粧をするグループが目につく。
sen.e: Especially in the case of Yosakoi, the groups which wear the showy makeup to remind us of kumadori in Kabuki are numerous and remarkable.
In Yosakai especially, numerous groups wear showy makeup to remind people of kumadori in Kabuki.
sen.cmt: eliminated "remarkably"; changed location of "especially"; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: In Yosakai especially, numerous groups wear showy makeup to remind people of kumadori in Kabuki.

sen.j: 姫島盆踊り(姫島村)では歌舞伎舞踊と同様だが青いアイシャドーを使う場合がある。
sen.e: In Himeshima Bon Odori (Himeshima Bon Festival Dance) (Himeshima Village, Oita Prefecture), the dancers wear the makeup similar to Kabuki Buyo, but sometimes use the blue eye shadow
sen.cmt: 「姫島盆踊り」は用語集に「Himejima Bon...」と登録されているが、「姫島村」の読みは「ひめしまむら」なのでこちらに統一する。
sen.e: In Himeshima Bon Odori (Himeshima Bon Festival Dance) (Himeshima Village, Oita Prefecture), although dancers wear makeup similar to Kabuki Buyo, they sometimes use blue eye shadow.
sen.cmt: changed "but" to "although"; added period; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In Himeshima Bon Odori (Himeshima Bon Festival Dance) (Himeshima Village, Oita Prefecture), although dancers wear makeup similar to Kabuki Buyo, they sometimes use blue eye shadow.

sen.j: 世界各地の伝統芸能(特に東アジア、東南アジア)でも厚化粧の傾向がある。
sen.e: The traditional performing arts in all over the world (especially in East Asia and Southeast Asia) have a tendency to wear atsugesho, too.
In traditional performing arts all over the world (especially in East Asia and Southeast Asia) there is a tendency to wear atsugesho as well.
sen.cmt: changed "The" to "In"; changed "too" to "as well"; fixed grammar
sen.e: In traditional performing arts all over the world (especially in East Asia and Southeast Asia) there is a tendency to wear atsugesho as well.

sen.j: バトンガール、チアガール、カラーガード隊、等も団体によっては厚化粧の場合が多い。
sen.e: Some groups of baton twirlers, cheerleaders, color guard teams, and so on also often wear atsugesho.
Some groups of baton twirlers, cheerleaders, color guard teams, etc. also often wear atsugesho.
Some groups of baton twirlers, cheerleaders, color guard teams, etc. also often wear atsugesho.

sen.j: 素人歌舞伎
sen.e: Amateur Kabuki
Amateur Kabuki
Amateur Kabuki

sen.j: 基本的に上記の歌舞伎と同じだが、化粧に慣れてない人が多いため、眉や口紅がかすれた感じになったりして、素人歌舞伎らしい素朴な感じになる場合が多い。
sen.e: The makeup of amateur Kabuki is basically the same as aforesaid Kabuki, but because most of the performers are not accustomed to wearing makeup, the paintings of eyebrows or lipsticks often get blurred to make an unaffected impression which is just like amateur Kabuki.

The makeup of amateur Kabuki is basically the same as the Kabuki described above, but because most of the performers are not accustomed to wearing makeup, their painted eyebrows and lipstick often get blurred, giving the impression of amateur Kabuki.
sen.cmt: changed "aforesaid" to "described above"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The makeup of amateur Kabuki is basically the same as the Kabuki described above, but because most of the performers are not accustomed to wearing makeup, their painted eyebrows and lipstick often get blurred, giving the impression of amateur Kabuki.

sen.j: 地方によっては専門家が化粧する場合があり、その場合は非常に洗練された美しい仕上がりになる。
sen.e: In some regions, the experts sometimes help them wear makeup, and in those cases the final conditions can be very sophisticated and beautiful.
In some regions, experts sometimes help them wear makeup, and in those cases the final conditions can be very sophisticated and beautiful.
In some regions, experts sometimes help them wear makeup, and in those cases the final conditions can be very sophisticated and beautiful.

sen.j: 時代行列
sen.e: Jidai Gyoretsu
Jidai Gyoretsu
Jidai Gyoretsu

sen.j: 平安時代や江戸時代を再現した時代行列では、あでやかな衣装を着て鬘を被るため、それに見合うように、屋外で行われる場合でも歌舞伎舞踊、民謡舞踊と同様の厚化粧をする。
sen.e: In Jidai Gyoretsu (a procession of people in historical costumes) to reproduce the manners of the Heian period, the Edo Period, etc., as people wear the gorgeous costumes and the wigs, to harmonize with them they wear the atsugesho similar to those of Kabuki Buyo and Minyo Buyo, even if it is held outdoors.

In Jidai Gyoretsu (a procession of people in historical costumes) where they reproduce the manners of the Heian and Edo Periods, people wear gorgeous costumes and wigs, and to harmonize with their costumes they wear atsugesho similar to that of Kabuki Buyo and Minyo Buyo, even if it is held outdoors.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In Jidai Gyoretsu (a procession of people in historical costumes) where they reproduce the manners of the Heian and Edo Periods, people wear gorgeous costumes and wigs, and to harmonize with their costumes they wear atsugesho similar to that of Kabuki Buyo and Minyo Buyo, even if it is held outdoors.

sen.j: 多くの場合、専門家が化粧するため、非常に洗練された美しい仕上がりになる。
sen.e: In most cases, the experts help people wear makeup, so that the final conditions can be very sophisticated and beautiful.
In most cases, experts help the people wear makeup so that the final conditions are sophisticated and beautiful.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In most cases, experts help the people wear makeup so that the final conditions are sophisticated and beautiful.

sen.j: 晴れ着、フォーマル
sen.e: Haregi, or Formals
Haregi or Formal Clothing
Haregi or Formal Clothing

sen.j: 洋服系の場合は素顔のままか、薄化粧の場合が多いが、和服系の場合は洋服系の場合より厚化粧になる傾向がある。
sen.e: When one is dressed up in Western clothes as haregi, he or she usually wears no makeup or light makeup, but when one is dressed up in Japanese traditional clothes, he or she puts on heavier makeup than in Western clothes.

When one is dressed up in Western clothes as a haregi, they usually wear light or no makeup, but when one is dressed up in Japanese traditional clothes, they put on heavier makeup than in Western clothes.
sen.cmt: he or she > they; fixed grammar
sen.e: When one is dressed up in Western clothes as a haregi, they usually wear light or no makeup, but when one is dressed up in Japanese traditional clothes, they put on heavier makeup than in Western clothes.

sen.j: 特に少女は洋服の場合は化粧しないか、しても薄化粧の場合が多いが、和服の場合は化粧する場合が多く、時には厚化粧になる。
sen.e: Especially, a girl usually wears no makeup or light makeup if she does any in Western clothes, but often wears makeup, and sometimes wears atsugesho in Japanese traditional clothes.
Girls especially, who wear light or no makeup when wearing Western clothes, often wear atsugesho when they are in Japanese traditional clothes.
sen.cmt: changed location of "Especially"; no makeup or light makeup > light or no makeup; eliminated "but often wears makeup; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Girls especially, who wear light or no makeup when wearing Western clothes, often wear atsugesho when they are in Japanese traditional clothes.

sen.j: 少年も和服の場合は極稀に化粧する場合がある。
sen.e: A boy, too, sometimes wears makeup excessively in Japanese traditional clothes.
Boys sometimes wear makeup excessively when they are wearing Japanese traditional clothes as well.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Boys sometimes wear makeup excessively when they are wearing Japanese traditional clothes as well.

sen.j: この場合の少女の化粧には少年のふんどしと同様、通過儀礼の色彩がある。
sen.e: A girl's makeup in this case has a meaning of the rite of passage like a boy's fundoshi (loincloth).
In this case, a girl's makeup carries the meaning of the rite of passage, similar to a boy's fundoshi (loincloth).
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In this case, a girl's makeup carries the meaning of the rite of passage, similar to a boy's fundoshi (loincloth).

sen.j: 発表会
sen.e: Recital
Recital
Recital

sen.j: 音楽系の発表会では、洋楽系の場合は化粧しない場合が多いが、民謡、和楽器の場合は和服を着る場合が多く、それに合わせて、時には厚化粧になる。
sen.e: As to the recitals of various music, one often wears no makeup in the case of Western music, but in the case of Minyo or wagakki (traditional Japanese musical instrument) one is usually dressed up in Japanese traditional clothes, and so sometimes wears atsugesho in harmony with the clothes.

As for recitals of various types of music, people often wear no makeup with Western music, but in Minyo or wagakki (a traditional Japanese musical instrument), they usually dress up in Japanese traditional clothes and sometimes wear atsugesho to harmonize with their clothes.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: As for recitals of various types of music, people often wear no makeup with Western music, but in Minyo or wagakki (a traditional Japanese musical instrument), they usually dress up in Japanese traditional clothes and sometimes wear atsugesho to harmonize with their clothes.

sen.j: 歌舞伎舞踊、民謡舞踊の場合は上記の舞台化粧を専門家が化粧する場合が多く、非常に美しい仕上がりになる。
sen.e: In the case of Kabuki Buyo or Minyo Buyo, the experts often help the performers wear the aforesaid stage makeup, the final conditions can be very beautiful.
In the case of Kabuki Buyo or Minyo Buyo, experts often help the performers wear their stage makeup and the final conditions can be very beautiful.
sen.cmt: changed the comma after "makeup" to an "and"; fixed grammar
sen.e: In the case of Kabuki Buyo or Minyo Buyo, experts often help the performers wear their stage makeup and the final conditions can be very beautiful.

sen.j: バレエの場合は保護者が化粧する場合が多いため、専門家が化粧する場合より、仕上がりにばらつきが見られる場合が多い。
sen.e: In the case of the ballet, because the parents or guardians help the performers wear makeup, the final conditions can be often more uneven than the case where the experts help them wear makeup.
In the case of the ballet, since parents or guardians help the performers wear makeup, the final conditions are often more uneven than when experts help them wear makeup.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In the case of the ballet, since parents or guardians help the performers wear makeup, the final conditions are often more uneven than when experts help them wear makeup.

sen.j: 変身スタジオ
sen.e: Transformational Studio
Transformational Studio
Transformational Studio

sen.j: 舞妓変身、時代劇、宝塚歌劇、等の変身スタジオ(京都市内に多い)では、それぞれの役柄に応じて実際の舞妓、芸妓、俳優と同じ衣装、鬘が用意され、同じ厚化粧をして貰える場合が多い。
sen.e: The transformational studios (we can find a lot of them in Kyoto City), such as maiko makeover, jidaigeki, Takarazuka Revue, and so on, can often provide us the same costumes and wigs as the actual maiko, geigi or actors depending on each role of them, and help us wear the same atsugesho.

Transformational studios (many are found in Kyoto City), such as maiko makeovers, jidaigeki, Takarazuka Revue, and so on, often provide the same costumes and wigs as actual maiko, geigi or actors depending on their roles, as well as assist in putting on atsugesho.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Transformational studios (many are found in Kyoto City), such as maiko makeovers, jidaigeki, Takarazuka Revue, and so on, often provide the same costumes and wigs as actual maiko, geigi or actors depending on their roles, as well as assist in putting on atsugesho.

sen.j: 化粧する専門家が常駐してるため、非常に美しい仕上がりになる。
sen.e: Because the experts on makeup are always on standby in those studio, the final conditions of makeup can be very beautiful.
Since the experts on makeup are always on standby in these studios, the final conditions of the makeup can be very beautiful.
Since the experts on makeup are always on standby in these studios, the final conditions of the makeup can be very beautiful.

sen.j: その他
sen.e: The Others
Others
Others

sen.j: 主に北関東の山車祭りにおいては祭囃子の奏者、御輿の担ぎ手、山車の引き手となる少年少女が厚化粧をする場合が多い(浜松まつり(浜松市)も同様)(南関東は素顔の場合が多い)。
sen.e: Mainly in the Northern Kanto region, the boys and girls who take part in dashi matsuri (float festival) as players of matsuri-bayashi (Japanese festival music), carriers of mikoshi (portable shrine), and haulers of dashi (float) often wears atsugesho (it's the same with Hamamatsu Matsuri (Hamamatsu City)) (in Southern Kanto region, they usually wear no makeup).

Mainly in the Northern Kanto region, boys and girls who take part in dashi matsuri (float festival) as players of matsuri-bayashi (Japanese festival music), carriers of mikoshi (a portable shrine), and haulers of dashi (a float) often wear atsugesho (the same as with Hamamatsu Matsuri (Hamamatsu City)) (in the Southern Kanto region they usually do not wear makeup).

Mainly in the Northern Kanto region, boys and girls who take part in dashi matsuri (float festival) as players of matsuri-bayashi (Japanese festival music), carriers of mikoshi (a portable shrine), and haulers of dashi (a float) often wear atsugesho (the same as with Hamamatsu Matsuri (Hamamatsu City)) (in the Southern Kanto region they usually do not wear makeup).

sen.j: 西日本では太鼓台の乗り子が稚児と同様の厚化粧(地方によっては歌舞伎の隈取りと同様の化粧)をする場合が多い。
sen.e: In Western Japan, noriko (riding kids) of taiko-dai (floats to carry drums on) often wears the atsugesho similar to chigo (in some regions, the makeup similar to kumadori of Kabuki).
In Western Japan, noriko (riding kids) of taiko-dai (floats to carry drums on) often wear atsugesho similar to chigo (in some regions, the makeup is similar to kumadori of Kabuki).
sen.cmt: wears > wears; the makeup similar > the makeup is similar
sen.e: In Western Japan, noriko (riding kids) of taiko-dai (floats to carry drums on) often wear atsugesho similar to chigo (in some regions, the makeup is similar to kumadori of Kabuki).

sen.j: 又、祭りの中で、男性が女装する場合がある(女装祭り)が、その場合は必ず厚化粧になる。
sen.e: Moreover, there are some cases in which men disguise themselves as women in the festivals (drag festivals), and in those cases they always wear atsugesho.
Moreover, there are some cases in which men disguise themselves as women during festivals (drag festivals), in which case they always wear atsugesho.
Moreover, there are some cases in which men disguise themselves as women during festivals (drag festivals), in which case they always wear atsugesho.

sen.j: 若い女性が休日に公園等でコスプレやゴスロリファッションを着用するときにも厚化粧になる場合が多い。
sen.e: And when young women are dressed up in Kosupure (costume play to transform oneself to a favorite character) or Gosurori (Gothic Lolita) fashion in the parks on holidays too, they often wear atsugesho.

When young women get dressed up in Kosupure (cosplay; costume play to transform oneself into a favorite character) or Gosurori (Gothic Lolita) fashions in parks and on holidayds they often wear atsugesho.

When young women get dressed up in Kosupure (cosplay; costume play to transform oneself into a favorite character) or Gosurori (Gothic Lolita) fashions in parks and on holidayds they often wear atsugesho.
